definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: Non-resistance to the tedium, however, can make it a lot less painful.
sentences.chinese: 不去抵制单调乏味，可以减轻你的痛苦。

sentences.english: This lawyer verbalizes and is rather tedious.
sentences.chinese: 这位律师唠唠叨叨，单调乏味。

sentences.english: The process of review and verification on install can be tedious.
sentences.chinese: 安装的复查和验证过程可能会十分单调乏味。

sentences.english: It would make our lives really dull.
sentences.chinese: 那真的会使生活单调乏味。

sentences.english: Trying to straighten this out would be tedious and error prone.
sentences.chinese: 试图弄清楚这一点很单调乏味，而且容易出错。

sentences.english: What characterizes almost all TV programs is their monotony.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有电视节目都很单调乏味。

sentences.english: But too often the image they see is one of tedious study.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们太经常看到的是一种单调乏味的学习景象。

definition: ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
thousand articles, same rule (idiom); stereotyped and repetitive/once you've seen one, you've seen them all
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
